text: 'Cangjie programming language_cjc_conditional compilation_conditional_compilation_overview': 'In Cangjie code language, Conditional compilation in Cangjie allows developers to compile code based on predefined or custom conditions. Cangjie supports conditional compilation for imports and declarations using the @When built-in compilation flag. Conditions are specified within square brackets [] and can include multiple conditions.'

'Cangjie programming language_cjc_conditional compilation_built_in_conditions': 'In Cangjie code language, Cangjie provides several built-in conditions for conditional compilation:
os: Target platform's operating system (Windows, Linux, macOS).
backend: Target backend and processor architecture (cjnative, cjnative-x86_64, cjnative-aarch64).
cjc_version: Version of the Cangjie compiler.
debug: Indicates whether debug mode is enabled.
test: Indicates whether unit testing is enabled.'

'Cangjie programming language_cjc_conditional compilation_custom_conditions': 'In Cangjie code language, Cangjie allows developers to define custom compilation conditions. Custom conditions must be valid identifiers and cannot overlap with built-in conditions. Values are string literals. Custom conditions are defined using the --cfg compilation option or in the cfg.toml configuration file.'

Code_Example:
# Defining custom condition via command line
cjc --cfg "my_condition=value"
# Defining custom condition in cfg.toml
[custom]
my_condition = "value"
